article.headline: Santa Clara 57, Loyola Marymnt 57
article.story: LOS ANGELES (AP) -- Kyle Bailey scored 27 points -- 23 in the second half -- to lead Santa Clara to a 68-57 victory over Loyola Marymount Thursday. Bailey shot 9-for-15 from the field and also had six rebounds as the Broncos (10-9, 3-1 West Coast Conference) won their third straight game after losing their previous five. The Lions (9-9, 1-4) lost their third in a row and have dropped seven of their last nine. Travis Niesen added 10 points and six rebounds for Santa Clara. Santa Clara built their biggest lead of the game, 48-37, on Niesen's basket with 10:15 to play. Loyola Marymount trimmed the lead to 60-55 on two free throws by Dustin Brown with 3:03 left, but the Bronocs followed with an 8-2 run and the Lions failed to score for the remainder of the game. Mattthew Knight led Loyola Marymount with 20 points, and Charles Brown had 15 points, seven rebounds and seven assists for the Lions.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
